item.title: ‘His life is hanging by a thread’: Doctors on fasting farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal - Hindustan Times
item.description:
‘His life is hanging by a thread’: Doctors on fasting farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal

Date: Dec 19, 2024 Source: HT News Desk

Farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal has entered the 24th day of his fast-unto-death, pressing the government for a legal guarantee of minimum support price (MSP) for crops. His health has deteriorated significantly, and he is now in a critical condition, at risk of cardiac arrest.

Key Points:

  • Dallewal, 70, has not eaten for 24 days as part of his protest.
  • Doctors report that his health is critical, with risks of cardiac arrest and multi-organ failure.
  • The Supreme Court has criticized the Punjab government for failing to conduct timely health tests on Dallewal.
“His life is hanging by a thread.” - Doctors attending Dallewal

The situation is becoming increasingly urgent as his health continues to decline.

item.title: ‘Mukesh Rajput’s BP still high, Pratap Sarangi a cardiac patient': Doctors on injured BJP MPs - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Injured BJP MPs Mukesh Rajput and Pratap Sarangi Hospitalized Following Parliament Scuffle

Date: Dec 19, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Two BJP MPs, Mukesh Rajput and Pratap Sarangi, were admitted to RML Hospital due to injuries sustained during a scuffle outside Parliament. Doctors reported that both MPs had head injuries and were being monitored for blood pressure-related issues.

  • Both MPs admitted to RML Hospital following injuries from an altercation.
  • Doctors stated that both sustained head injuries and have high blood pressure concerns.
  • Defence Minister Rajnath Singh visited the MPs and reported that they would remain in the hospital for observation.
  • Ajay Shukla, the Medical Superintendent, provided updates on their conditions.
  • The incident has sparked political tensions, with BJP and Congress filing complaints against each other.
“Rajput ji's blood pressure is still high. We are doing our best possible.” – Dr. Ajay Shukla

The condition of the MPs requires careful observation following a violent confrontation that underscores ongoing political tensions.

item.title: Parliament Winter Session LIVE: Cong accuses BJP workers of attacking its Mumbai office - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Parliament Winter Session LIVE: Cong president Kharge accuses BJP of ‘pre-planned conspiracy’

Date: December 19, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The Parliament Winter Session is nearing its end amid rising tensions over Home Minister Amit Shah's remarks on Dr. BR Ambedkar. Opposition parties are demanding his resignation, while Congress's Mallikarjun Kharge has accused the BJP of orchestrating a distraction to shift focus from these comments.

  • High drama unfolded during the session as opposition MPs protested against Amit Shah's remarks.
  • Two BJP MPs reported injuries related to pushing by Congress members during the protest.
  • Congress plans a nationwide protest demanding Shah's resignation, with Kharge urging PM Modi to act swiftly.
  • Claims of a conspiracy by the BJP to disrupt opposition protests have been voiced by several Congress leaders.
“Every Indian who believes in social justice will fight against BJP’s oppressive tyranny and Manuvadi mindset!” - Mallikarjun Kharge

The ongoing conflict highlights deep political divisions and the challenge of maintaining decorum within parliamentary proceedings.

item.title: Parliament Winter Session LIVE: Congress office in Mumbai vandalised by BJP workers after row - Hindustan Times
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: "You Will Be Chief Minister Someday": Devendra Fadnavis Tells Ajit Pawar - NDTV
item.description:
You Will Be Chief Minister Someday: Devendra Fadnavis Tells Ajit Pawar

Date: August 12, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis expresses support for Ajit Pawar's dreams of becoming Chief Minister during a legislative assembly session.

  • Fadnavis, Ajit Pawar, and Eknath Shinde plan to work in shifts.
  • Fadnavis acknowledged Ajit Pawar's ongoing ambitions and offered encouragement.
  • Ajit Pawar recently became the Deputy Chief Minister for the sixth time.
  • Pawar's faction broke from the Nationalist Congress Party and joined the BJP-led government.
  • The NCP faction led by Pawar saw electoral success in recent assembly elections.
  • The Mahayuti alliance significantly outperformed the MVA coalition in election results.
“You are called 'permanent deputy CM'... but my wishes are with you... you will be the Chief Minister someday.” - Devendra Fadnavis

This dialogue highlights the ongoing ambitions of Ajit Pawar within Maharashtra's political landscape, indicating potential future leadership opportunities.

item.title: 'Congress has always hated Ambedkar, did crocodile tears for him': Dharmendra Pradhan shares 'shameful' c - The Times of India
item.description:
Congress has always hated Ambedkar, did crocodile tears for him: Dharmendra Pradhan shares 'shameful' cartoon

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Not specified

In a recent statement, Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan criticized Congress for its treatment of Dr. B.R. Ambedkar, referring to a cartoon he deemed 'shameful'.

  • Pradhan emphasizes the historical bias against Ambedkar by the Congress party.
  • He questions the sincerity of Congress's gestures commemorating Ambedkar.
  • The statement comes amidst ongoing political debates about legacy and representation in Indian politics.
'The crocodile tears shed by Congress for Ambedkar are nothing but hypocrisy.'

The remarks prompt a discussion on the ongoing political discourse regarding Dr. Ambedkar's legacy and the perception of different political parties towards it.

item.title: 'Blot On Constitutional Spirit' : Supreme Court Aghast At Attack & Disrobing Of Woman Over Witchcraft... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court Shocked by Public Disrobing of Woman Accused of Witchcraft

Publication Date: October 31, 2023

Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court expressed its astonishment at a case involving the public disrobing and abuse of a woman labeled as a witch. The Court highlighted the severity of such acts in modern society and emphasized the importance of human dignity.

  • The incident occurred in March 2020 in Bihar, where 13 individuals were accused of physically assaulting a woman and her grandmother over witchcraft allegations.
  • The Supreme Court criticized the lack of action by the State in addressing the stay order granted by the Patna High Court.
  • The judges stressed that human dignity is crucial to the constitutional framework and condemned the targeting of women with witchcraft allegations.
  • In 2022, 85 cases related to witchcraft were reported in India, alongside a troubling trend of disrobing cases.
“Dignity goes to the very core of the existence of an individual in society. Any action which undermines dignity...is potentially going against the spirit of the Constitution.”

The Supreme Court reiterated the necessity for legislative and societal changes to protect women's rights and dignity. It ended the session by instructing the Trial Court to expedite the trial process.

item.title: Nine Jharkhand officers to become IAS without appearing for UPSC exam; here's how - DNA India
item.description:
Nine Jharkhand Officers to Become IAS Without UPSC Exam

Publication Date: December 2024, Source: DNA India

The Jharkhand government is set to promote nine senior JAS officers to IAS cadre without requiring them to appear for the UPSC Civil Services Exam, following their recommendation by the state.

  • Promotion applies to all vacancies pertaining to 2023.
  • A panel of eligible JAS officers was prepared by the Jharkhand government.
  • 27 names were recommended to the UPSC for consideration.
  • A meeting took place between state officials and the UPSC in New Delhi.
  • The proposal will be sent to the Ministry of Personnel, Government of India.
“Becoming an IAS officer is a dream for many as the prestigious job provides many opportunities to do the welfare of society.”

This initiative underscores the state's commitment to recognizing dedicated service among its administrative officers, paving new pathways for civil service advancement.

item.title: Case filed against KTR over Rs 45-crore payment to hold Formula E race in Hyderabad - The Indian Express
item.description:
Case Filed Against KTR Over Rs 45-Crore Payment for Formula E Race in Hyderabad

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Telangana’s Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) has filed a case against K T Rama Rao, the working president of Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS), over alleged irregularities related to the Formula E racing event held in Hyderabad.

  • KTR is accused of authorizing payments without proper Cabinet clearance.
  • Rs 45 crore was allegedly paid to the Formula E Organisers in violation of RBI guidelines.
  • The ACB's investigation followed a fine imposed by the RBI on the Telangana government for unauthorized transactions.
  • The FIR includes charges under the Prevention of Corruption Act, IPC sections 409 (criminal breach of trust), and 120B (criminal conspiracy).
  • KTR has denied any wrongdoing, stating that the event aimed to enhance Hyderabad's global image.
“I am willing to go to jail if anything illegal is found. I will use the jail time to stay fit and plan a padayatra.” - K T Rama Rao

This case raises significant issues regarding governance and transparency in public spending during high-profile events.

item.title: 'How Can You Ask Elephants To Keep 3 Meter Distance? Kerala High Court's Directions Impractical': Supreme ... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court Questions Kerala High Court's Elephant Distance Rule

Date: December 19, 2023 | Source: LiveLaw

The Supreme Court has stayed the Kerala High Court's restriction mandating a 3-meter distance between elephants during temple festivals, citing impracticality and a lack of violation complaints.

  • The Supreme Court intervened to stay the Kerala High Court’s directions regarding elephants in temple festivals.
  • High Court's direction for a three-meter distance between elephants was deemed impractical.
  • Justice Nagarathna stated that animal rights should not disrupt existing customs.
  • The Supreme Court emphasized compliance with existing rules from 2012 regarding captive elephant management.
  • Concerns were raised about the monitoring of a 250-year-old festival and its cultural significance.
“How do you expect the elephant to maintain 3 meters distance? Practically impossible.” - Justice BV Nagarathna

The Supreme Court's decision highlights the need for balance between traditional practices and animal welfare laws, emphasizing the importance of adhering to existing regulations while considering the cultural significance of festivals.

item.title: PM Modi Dials BJP MPs Hurt In Big Showdown, Congress's Kharge Says He's Injured Too | Top Points - News18
item.description:
PM Modi Contacts Injured BJP MPs Amid Parliament Tensions

Publication Date: December 19, 2024

Source: News18

After two BJP MPs were injured during a confrontation with opposition MPs in Parliament, PM Modi reached out to inquire about their health, highlighting the tensions surrounding recent protests.

  • PM Modi called BJP MPs Pratap Sarangi and Mukesh Rajput after they were injured during jostling in Parliament.
  • Dr. Ajay Shukla confirmed the PM’s inquiry into the MPs' conditions.
  • Mallikarjun Kharge alleged he was injured due to physical interactions with BJP MPs.
  • Congress MPs claimed Rahul Gandhi was also manhandled during the incident.
  • The situation escalated as both NDA and INDIA bloc MPs protested over the Ambedkar issue, leading to the injuries.
“He spoke with both of them and tried to make them understand to not worry and that they would be fine.” - Dr. Ajay Shukla

The incident underscores ongoing tensions in Parliament and reflects political divisions over recent comments made regarding BR Ambedkar.

item.title: Rajya Sabha Deputy Chairman dismisses Opposition’s notice for VP Dhankhar’s removal - The Indian Express
item.description:
Rajya Sabha Deputy Chairman dismisses Opposition’s notice for VP Dhankhar’s removal

Date: December 2024
Source: Indian Express

Rajya Sabha Deputy Chairman Harivansh has rejected the impeachment notice filed by the opposition against Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar, calling it a flawed act aimed at undermining constitutional institutions.

  • The impeachment notice was marked by 60 Opposition members.
  • Accusations against Dhankhar include being “explicitly partisan”.
  • The Deputy Chairman described the notice as “lacking factual basis” and an attempt for publicity.
  • This action marks a historical first in India's parliamentary history.
“The notice was an act of impropriety, being severely flawed and drawn in haste to mar his reputation.” - Harivansh

The ruling emphasizes the importance of preserving the integrity of constitutional offices amidst political disputes.

item.title: People Seeking Justice For Atul Subhash Chase Rahul Gandhi. He Does This - NDTV
item.description:
Activists Chase Rahul Gandhi for Justice for Atul Subhash

Publication Date: December 19, 2024 Source: NDTV

A group of activists demanding justice for techie Atul Subhash chased Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's cavalcade on the streets of Delhi. Their efforts were aimed at raising awareness of Atul's tragic suicide and the need for accountability regarding alleged harassment faced by him.

  • Atul Subhash died by suicide on December 9 after alleging harassment from his estranged wife and her family.
  • Activists argue that laws meant to protect women are being misused against men.
  • Despite the public interest, no political leader has addressed this issue until now.
  • Ms. Deepika Narayan Bhardwaj, a lawyer-activist, has been vocal about the misuse of anti-dowry laws.
  • Rahul Gandhi engaged briefly with the activists during the chase, throwing a chocolate to them.
No Parliamentarian has spoken about tragic suicide by #AtulSubhash and the reasons behind suicides by so many men in India. — Deepika Narayan Bhardwaj

The incident underscores the activists' urgent plea for justice and the hope that it will prompt political action on these critical issues affecting many individuals in society.

item.title: Parliament Winter Session Day 20 LIVE Updates: Parliament row escalates as BJP, Congress trade charges over ‘scuffle’ at Makar Dwar - The Indian Express
item.description:
Rajya Sabha Rejects No-Confidence Motion Against Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar

Date: December 21, 2024 • Source: Indian Express

The 20th day of the Winter Session saw the Rajya Sabha deputy chairman dismissing the impeachment notice against Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar. Allegations of bias were made by around 60 opposition members who signed the notice.

  • Opposition members claimed not to have trust in Dhankhar, labeling him as biased.
  • A scuffle occurred on Parliament premises between members of the INDIA and BJP alliances.
  • BJP MP Pratap Chandra Sarangi accused Rahul Gandhi of pushing an MP that led to injuries.
  • A Joint Parliamentary Committee was announced to review the ‘One Nation, One Election’ Bill.
“The BJP MPs are trying to deflect from the real issue,” stated Rahul Gandhi.

This session highlights ongoing tensions between opposition and ruling party members over procedural disputes and legislative changes.

item.title: Before his elevation, SC judge D.Y. Chandrachud had flagged Justice Yadav’s RSS, BJP links - The Leaflet
item.description:
Concerns Raised Over Justice Yadav's Judicial Appointment Due to Controversial Links

Published on: 19 Dec 2024, 9:01 am | Source: The Leaflet

Justice Shekhar Kumar Yadav's controversial comments and affiliations have come under scrutiny, raising questions about his suitability for the bench. This situation highlights the concerns previously flagged by a now Chief Justice of India regarding his judicial appointment.

  • The Supreme Court's Collegium ignored strong opposition from Justice D.Y. Chandrachud against Yadav’s elevation as a judge.
  • Yadav was appointed as an additional judge on December 12, 2019, despite concerns raised about his links to the RSS and BJP.
  • Controversial remarks by Yadav against Muslims have led to calls for his impeachment by Rajya Sabha MPs.
  • The Supreme Court has summoned Yadav to explain his public statements amid ongoing tensions regarding his judicial conduct.
“He is not suitable for appointment as a judge of the High Court,” Justice D.Y. Chandrachud.

Concerns about judicial integrity are at the forefront of this unfolding situation, impacting public perception of the judiciary.

item.title: CAT Result 2024 LIVE Updates: When is IIM CAT 2024 score card releasing at iimcat.ac.in? - The Indian Express
item.description:
CAT Result 2024 LIVE Updates: IIM Sambalpur exits CAP 2025; results awaited at iimcat.ac.in

Publication Date: December 2024 Source: The Indian Express

The Indian Institute of Management (IIM) Calcutta has released the final answer keys for the Common Admission Test (CAT) 2024. The results are awaited and can be released anytime soon.

  • Approximately 3.29 lakh candidates registered for the CAT exam, with an attendance of about 89%.
  • The provisional answer keys were published on December 3, and candidates had until December 5 to raise objections.
  • The CAT 2024 exam was deemed easier than the last two years, possibly leading to a higher cut-off.
  • 1.07 lakh female candidates, 1.86 lakh male candidates, and 5 transgender candidates appeared for the exam.
  • Candidates with a valid CAT score will be eligible to register for PG programs at IIMs and other colleges.
"CAT 2024 was easier as compared to the last two years’ examination."

Overall, candidates are advised to stay updated as the results can be released at any moment.

item.title: 'Gundagardi karte ho?' What happened when Rahul Gandhi approached injured BJP MP Sarangi; watch video - The Times of India
item.description:
'Gundagardi karte ho?' What happened when Rahul Gandhi approached injured BJP MP Sarangi; watch video

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Times of India

This article discusses an incident involving Rahul Gandhi as he confronts injured BJP MP Sarangi. The exchange highlights political tensions and reactions.

  • Rahul Gandhi approached BJP MP Sarangi, who was reportedly injured.
  • The encounter was caught on video, highlighting the heated political atmosphere.
  • Gandhi's remarks included the phrase 'Gundagardi karte ho?', translating to 'Do you engage in hooliganism?'
  • The incident has sparked discussions on political decorum and rivalry.
'Gundagardi karte ho?' - Rahul Gandhi during the confrontation.

This incident sheds light on the ongoing hostilities in Indian politics and may further fuel discussions on political behavior.
